lines.text: Hey, you got the elevator fixed, Frankie.
Hey, not for you, Rosie. There's still a one-ton load limit.
I still don't know what the hell is going on here.
Ain't no rats, you can be sure of that.
Dad, you're going to have to deal with this. You got to think about it, make some decisions.
Annie, I'm going to eat my dinner, and then I'm going to watch some moronic situation comedy, and then I'm going to sleep the sleep of the dead. Can we worry about this tomorrow?
We really have to go now.
Don't be so quick. You're not as smart as you think you are.
You know if we can make it to the roof, I can get to the junction box outside, tie into the phone lines, call for help.
Hey, I can do anything. I work for the phone company.
I'm fine. So... uh... how about getting together sometime and doing something normal?
